task_description: Your task is to determine if unknown substance X is electrically conductive. The unknown substance X is located around the workshop. First, focus on the unknown substance X. If it is electrically conductive, place it in the orange box. If it is electrically nonconductive, place it in the yellow box.
next_step:
Thought: To test the electrical conductivity of unknown substance X, I need to build a simple circuit with a power source (battery), an indicator (blue light bulb), and two probes (wires) that can be immersed in the substance. If the substance is conductive, the circuit will complete, and the bulb will light up. I'll use the red wire and orange wire as probes. First, I must connect the battery to the blue light bulb to establish the base circuit. This will likely use one of the available wires (green, orange, or red), but I don't need to specify which wire yet—the system will handle it. After this, I'll attach the remaining wires to the battery and bulb to create the probes.

Action: connect battery to blue light bulb
next_obs: Connections must specify specific points of contact on polarized electrical components (e.g. anode, cathode)
